channel.title: Cmd
channel.description:
It keeps spamming this in the cmd [code=java][3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [REGISTERED]: itswicked [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue! [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. [3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet.[/code]
Yet my server runs fine, anyway to fix this?
I'm using PI

item.title: Cmd
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

No Idea

But this is what I found

if(lastDir != dir) {//???? found = true;//sets the boolean found to true break; }

if(!found) println_debug("Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet.");//prints the message on the cmd prompt if found is true.

If anyone cares to elaborate further then they can help you, But this is all I found.

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

[quote=“Sir Lethal, post:1, topic:386792”][code=java][3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [REGISTERED]: itswicked
[3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Fatal: couldn’t find connection vertex! Dropping
packet.
[3/16/11 7:28 PM]: [player-1]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue![/quote]

Okay the fatal couldn’t find connection vertex for the dropping packet. I’d need to see your packet code,
the invalid waypoint in walking queue is either:
The point isn’t done correctly, so someone purposely put it there.
Or
Maybe something to do with your client, any new maps?

Rip dropping packets and walking packets off another server and replace them with your current walking + dropping packets.[/code]

Read full topic
